definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: High flash point which ensures a safety working environment even under high current erosion operation.
sentences.chinese: 高闪点，就算是高电流量电蚀也极为安全。

sentences.english: Its high flash point and non-toxic nature insure safety in its application.
sentences.chinese: 其高闪点和无毒性确保应用安全。

sentences.english: High flash point which ensures a safety working environment even under high current erosion operations.
sentences.chinese: 高闪点，就算是高电流量电蚀也极为安全。

sentences.english: The flash point must be high, the display must be small, satisfies the fire protection the safety requirements.
sentences.chinese: 闪点要高，发挥性要小，以满足防火的安全要求。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the development of close flash point instruments for penetrant, which is an electronic thermometer with data display.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍一种渗透液闭口闪点测量仪器的研制。

sentences.english: The original OFP had a really unhelpful UI.
sentences.chinese: 原版闪点行动中的用户界面并不非常有用。

definition: cetane number (quality of light diesel fuel, measured by its ignition delay)
fraction (of a distillate)/key (one component part of a distillate)
